H0.text: The nucleus is the structure that controls what enters both plant cells and animal cells.

H1.text: Cell wall is the structure that controls what enters both plant cells and animal cells.

H2.text: Chloroplast controls what enters both plant cells and animal cells.

H3.text: The cell membrane controls what enters both plant cells and animal cells.

A4.text: The cell membrane is selectively permeable and able to regulate what enters and exits the cell, thus facilitating the transport of materials needed for survival.

A5.text: Fungi, bacteria, most archaea, and plants also have a cell wall, which provides a mechanical support to the cell and precludes the passage of larger molecules.

A6.text: 3D structures of proteins associated with plasma membrane of eukaryotic cells.

A7.text: Lipid composition and proteins of some eukariotic membranes
